headline: Trump squeezes defence industry in new arms race
summary: Donald Trump said he would curb defence industry bosses’ pay to force them to rearm the United States more quickly.

headline: Lockheed Martin, other defense stocks jump as Trump floats $1.5T defense budget
summary: Investing.com -- Defense stocks rebounded sharply in after-hours trading following President Donald Trump’s social media post outlining plans for a significantly increased defense budget.

headline: RTX and Other Defense Stocks Fall After Trump Says He’ll Ban Dividends, Buybacks
summary: Trump said defense contractors are too slow to deliver equipment and too slow to maintain and repair equipment.

headline: Lockheed Martin, Northrop Grumman Shares Hit by Trump Post on Share Buybacks
summary: Defense stocks including Lockheed Martin, Northrop Grumman and General Dynamics fell Wednesday afternoon after reports that President Trump is set to sign an executive order that will punish defense companies that repurchase stocks, pay dividends and reward executives with high salaries if they have Pentagon contracts that are over budget or behind schedule.

raw.headline: Lockheed Martin, Northrop Grumman Shares Hit by Trump Post on Share Buybacks
raw.summary: Defense stocks including Lockheed Martin, Northrop Grumman and General Dynamics fell Wednesday afternoon after reports that President Trump is set to sign an executive order that will punish defense companies that repurchase stocks, pay dividends and reward executives with high salaries if they have Pentagon contracts that are over budget or behind schedule.

headline: Defense stocks fall after Trump threatens to ban dividends, buybacks
summary: Investing.com -- Lockheed Martin (NYSE:LMT) stock fell 1.7%, Northrop Grumman (NYSE:NOC) dropped 2%, and other defense names were pressured Wednesday afternoon after President Donald Trump threatened to prohibit dividends and stock buybacks for defense companies.

raw.headline: Defense stocks fall after Trump threatens to ban dividends, buybacks
raw.summary: Investing.com -- Lockheed Martin (NYSE:LMT) stock fell 1.7%, Northrop Grumman (NYSE:NOC) dropped 2%, and other defense names were pressured Wednesday afternoon after President Donald Trump threatened to prohibit dividends and stock buybacks for defense companies.

headline: Gambit Emerges from Stealth with Adaptive Intelligence Layer for Autonomous Military Systems
summary: Gambit, the dual-use defense company building adaptive intelligence for autonomous systems, emerged from stealth today, announcing contract delivery within two major U.S. Department of War programs valued at more than $500 million combined, and commercial partnerships with AWS' public sector defense autonomy division, and Sierra Nevada Corporation, L3Harris, and RTX to scale delivery.

headline: RTX Recommends Shareholders Reject "Mini-Tender" Offer by Tutanota LLC
summary: RTX (NYSE: RTX) has received notice of an unsolicited "mini-tender" offer made by Tutanota LLC (Tutanota) to RTX shareholders to purchase up to 500,000 shares of RTX common stock at a purchase price of $130.00 per share. This offer is for shares representing less than 0.04 percent of the outstanding shares of RTX common stock. This offer price is approximately 24.02% below the closing price of RTX common stock on December 5, 2025 ($171.10), the last trading day before the date of the offer, and

headline: RTX (RTX) Valuation Check After Strong 1 Year Shareholder Return
summary: RTX (RTX) has drawn fresh attention as investors reassess the aerospace and defense group’s recent share performance, with the stock’s past 3 months and one year total returns standing out against its longer term record.
